column1: Rhudaur was the smallest of the kingdoms that originated from the break-up of Arnor (). The other kingdoms were Arthedain and Cardolan.
==Location==
Rhudaur formed the eastern part of Arnor
column2: and stretched from the Weather Hills with Weathertop to the river Bruinen. It reached to the Ettenmoors. It shared a long border with Cardolan along the Great East Road
column3: and with Arthedain along the line of the Weather Hills.

column1: The land between the rivers Mitheithel and Bruinen
column3: was also considered part of Rhudaur.

column1: ==History==
From the start of its existence
column2: Rhudaur was unfriendly towards the two other successor states
column3: and took part in a bitter conflict with Cardolan over the tower of Amon Sûl and the Palantíri associated with the tower.

column1: The first Stoors Hobbits came into Eriador around . However
column2: due to the increasing hostility of Angmar these Stoors fled the region around
column3: with some of them moving west to Arthedain
column4: and others moving back to the Vales of Anduin.

column1: The last Kings of Rhudaur were not of Númenórean blood
column2: but were descended of Hill-men; by the time of Argeleb I of Arnor
column3: Rhudaur was ruled by an evil lord who secretly was in league with Angmar
column4: and thus enemies of Cardolan and Arthedain. Argeleb died fighting Rhudaur and Angmar.

column1: Angmar annexed and terminated the kingdom in . By this time the Númenóreans were gone from the region
column2: as well as most of the other inhabitants.

column1: There is evidence that after the fall of Angmar at the Battle of Fornost the Angle became home to the remainder of the Dúnedain
column2: and the Rangers of the North established several villages there
column3: where their people lived until the resurrection of the northern Kingdom under Aragorn at the end of the Third Age.
